transcripts.text: This is prison!  This is prison!  This is prison!  These were the shocking scenes from Tenby just two days ago.  Now, you won't have seen any of this on mainstream television because they don't cover these stories, but remember, I've been covering on these YouTube films army camps being filled up with those crossing the channel illegally.  We started off in Shorncliffe in Kent.

One of the barracks here, the Napier Barracks, well, that is currently undergoing a big refit because later on this week, It won't be the Ministry of Defence that owns the Napier Barracks here at Shorncliffe.  It'll be the Home Office.
Penally Camp in Tenby in West Wales was the second.  And just before Christmas, I visited Barton Stacey in Hampshire.
Rob, you put me in touch with this.  You're a local guy.  Correct.  What have we got here?

Basically, this is a new site where 500 asylum seekers will be housed temporarily.  If it all gets voted through, basically.  They say temporarily, but... Like I say, the average claim, I think, takes about six months.

And then there's an appeals process where they're going to build accommodation for about 500 people who've illegally come to Britain and who are put into camps or into four-star hotels or into private accommodation while they wait for their asylum claim to be rejected.
